articles.author: Shristi A, Amruta Khandekar
articles.description: Wall Street's main indexes rose on Monday as a pullback in Treasury yields boosted megacap growth stocks ahead of key inflation and jobs data this week that will offer more clues on the Federal Reserve's interest rate path.
articles.title: Wall St gains on boost from megacaps ahead of key economic data

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: The United States and China have agreed to launch an export control enforcement information dialogue and a new formal working group on commercial issues, the U.S. Commerce Department said on Monday, giving Beijing a potential forum to express concerns.
articles.title: US and China agree to export control information dialogue

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Shares of Vietnamese electric-vehicle maker Vinfast surged 30% in premarket trading on Monday, extending a rally from last week that more than quadrupled its market value to $160 billion.
articles.title: Vinfast rallies on after becoming world's third-most valuable automaker

articles.author: Daniel Wiessner
articles.description: A U.S. appeals court has revived claims that McDonald's Corp (MCD.N) violated federal antitrust law by requiring franchisees to agree not to hire away each other's employees.
articles.title: McDonald's must face antitrust claims over worker 'poaching,' court rules

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hawaiian Electric's (HE.N) shares jumped nearly 40% on Monday after the electric utility said it was not responsible for the wildfires in Maui earlier this month, saying its power lines had been shut for hours prior to the deadliest blaze that devastated the island.
articles.title: Hawaiian Electric denies Maui lawsuit claims about cause of wildfire, shares surge

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Organized cybercrime is set to pose a threat to Canada's national security and economic prosperity over the next two years, the national signal intelligence agency said on Monday.
articles.title: Cybercrime set to threaten Canada's security, prosperity - spy agency

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Europe will continue to face a shortage of Eli Lilly & Co's (LLY.N) blockbuster diabetes drug Trulicity through September, the European Medicines Agency (EMA) said on Monday.
articles.title: Europe to face shortage of Lilly's diabetes drug through September

articles.author: Sarah N. Lynch
articles.description: Donald Trump will stand trial on March 4, 2024 in federal court in Washington for trying to overturn his 2020 election defeat, a federal judge ruled on Monday, setting up a crowded schedule for the former president next year as he campaigns to recapture the White House.
articles.title: Donald Trump federal election trial to start March 4, 2024, judge rules

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine said on Monday its troops had liberated the southeastern settlement of Robotyne and were trying to push further south in their counteroffensive against Russian forces.
articles.title: Ukraine says it liberates strategic southeastern settlement

articles.author: Sarah N. Lynch, Maria Caspani
articles.description: The white gunman who shot and killed three Black people at a Dollar General store in Jacksonville, Florida on Saturday was a 21-year-old who bought his guns legally and had no criminal history, local law enforcement said on Sunday.
articles.title: Jacksonville shooter killed Black shoppers with legally purchased guns
